item.title: After Dark Film Festival
item.description:
Toronto After Dark Film Festival showcases thrilling international cinema, and runs annually during the week before Halloween.

The frightening film festival features a diverse selection of feature film premieres and innovative short films in the genre of horror, sci-fi, and fantasy.

Last year there was the JHorror film Reincarnation � going on the standard from last year, this years films should be good as well. If you’re a horror fan you should definitely pick them up on DVD when they’re released.

Unfortunately I do not live anywhere near Toronto else I would have definitely attended.

item.title: Flickr
item.description:
Flickr is a photo sharing website, based around a great community. The basic idea is you upload your photos and share them with the world. But there are so many other great features and reaons to use Flickr.

There is a great community spirit around Flickr and it’s great to browse the huge range of photos and participate in their comments. There are groups you can join for a whole host of differing topics � enough to suit anyone (and more!).

You can restrict your photos for friends and family, tag them for easy grouping, put them in sets and those within groups and even add the geo-location information. The data associated with your photos is huge and all available using Flickr’s brilliant API.

I implore you to explore all the interesting photos for some spectacular shots

Sign up and try, because best of all it’s free!

item.title: Last.fm
item.description:
Last.fm is “the social music revolution”. Simply listen to music on your computer or iPod and Last.fm will save your playlists. Every song you listen to will become part of your music profile.

Once you’ve uploaded a few tracks, you can start enjoying all the features, including:

  • Automatically create personal music charts and radio station.
  • Discover, explore and listen to new music.
  • See what your friends are listening to.

Because Last.fm is a passive social website, all you need to do is create an account and listen to your music. The main idea of the website is to record your listening habits, but there is also a nice social aspect to the website. You can engage with users who listen to similar music and browse for new music based on your taste and listening habits of others.

item.title: Top Gear 'till Christmas!
item.description:
Getting the kids to bed without breaching the 8 o’clock deadline has become ever more stressful with the return of Clarkson, Hammond and the polite one with sympathetic hair in BBC2’s Top Gear - Sunday 8pm.

While there are still oil reserves man will endeavour to construct evermore creative ways of depleting supplies all in the name of entertainment. In episode one we see Lamborghini, Porsche, Aston Martin and Volkswagen none the less, doing their utmost to raise sea levels - fantastic!

Bit worrying to think I’ll be Christmas wrapping before the series ends in December.

item.title: Top Gear is Back!
item.description:
Top Gear, everyone’s favourite petrol-fueled TV show, is back on the BBC this Sunday (7th October). Hang out with Clarkson, Hammond and Captain Slow for a ten-week run of the best car show on earth.

They’ll be trans-country challenges (hopefully), stupidly expensive super-cars, celebrities in a reasonably priced car, the Stig racing around the track and no doubt plenty of non-PC jokes, especially about the Germans.

Tune in at 8pm on Sundays or catch the repeats on Wednesdays at 7pm.

item.title: Living Legend
item.description:
They say you can judge a man by his friends - well having a friend like Dave is a sure-fire way of dragging your average score up. My longest standing mate from 4th year Geography, and some 25 years on we will be celebrating his 39th Birthday this weekend. This guy is real Swiss Army Knife of a friend - he even a bloody good cook, God damn it!

Of course just knowing a legend doesn’t make you one yourself - I’ve got a long way to go but as long as Martin, Leigh, Rich and Dave don’t turn into mass murders I think I’ve got this sewn up.

Happy Birthday dude!

P.S. Alison says “every super hero has his nemesis - Superman has Kryptonite, Ian’s is a vacuum cleaner.”

item.title: Great North Run
item.description:
Well, my Brother and I did it! 13.1 miles of the Great North Run in 2 hours and 20 minutes. A bit slower than we would have liked, but what an experience.

Emotions ran high throughout the run and we both enjoyed the atmosphere and the company of all the other runners.

Thanks to everyone who kindly sponsored us, we raised almost �800 for the NSPCC.

I would also like to congratulate all those special people out there who completed the run and raised money for other good causes. Well done everyone!

item.title: Raindance Film Festival
item.description:
Today sees the start of the 15th annual Raindance Film Festival. The event is dedicated to promoting independent movies, from low or no budget productions to indie blockbusters.

The festival features upcoming movies as well as a range of courses for budding filmmakers who want to write, produce or direct their own film.

The festival is on in London until the 7th of October, so if you’re interested in film and in the area I recommend checking it out.

item.title: Nokia N95
item.description:
I finally upgraded my mobile phone to a Nokia N95.

This is now my fifth Nokia in a row. I have progressed many iterations including one with a qwerty keyboard (6800), a 6600 and the phone I’ve just replaced is a 6680. Each time the phone has functioned extremely well and I’ve never had one break (yet).

It has an amazing amount of features including Wi-Fi, a five mega-pixel camera and GPS. I’m really looking forward to using all the data and creating a web interface to browse the information. Stay tuned�

item.title: Run, Fatboy, Run
item.description:
David Schwimmer is at the helm in his theatrical directorial d�but, Run, Fatboy, Run: a story of love and perseverance but with a heavy twist of humour. The movie stars Simon Pegg as Dennis, the hapless protagonist yearning after his ex-fianc�e, who he left pregnant at the altar five years ago! Now a washed-up, unfit (but not fat) security guard for a lingerie store, he is trying to win back the respect of his son and the love of his life.

This isn’t the first time Simon Pegg and David Schwimmer have collaborated. They starred alongside one another in the overlooked heist-gone-wrong comedy of confusion and betrayal, Big Nothing. I highly recommend both Big Nothing and Run, Fatboy, Run if you’re a fan of British humour and sarcasm.
